purpose: To highlight the dependency of low-income households on market-rate rental units.
narrative_role: Supporting evidence for housing policy recommendations.
title: Low-income households are highly dependent on market-rate rental units

bullets.text: A large share of low-income people live in market-rate rentals
Most vouchers go to the poorest households
Most regulated units go to higher levels of income (30-80%)
The rate of homeownership drops significantly for poorer households, though is still significant at the bottom tier
Overall, a very large share of low-income households live in market rentals

supporting_facts: Includes LIHTC and public housing, MHA, and MFTE units
Does not include >100% AMI population category
reasoning_strategy: Data-driven analysis of income categories and housing situations.
data_points: Income categories: 80-100% AMI, 50-80% AMI, 30-50% AMI, 0-30% AMI
Housing situations: Home owners, Market Rate Rental, In Regulated Units, Using Vouchers
